title: Lucie Donlan blames Love Island bosses for making her look bad
text:
It’s not Lucie Donlan’s fault she didn’t come off well in Love Island, guys (Picture: ITV)

Love Island’s Lucie Donlan wasn’t happy for cutting out all of her funniest moments, claiming to be the unsuspecting victim of a bad edit.

The surfer and model was best known for her complicated love triangle with Joe Garratt (who she is now dating again) and Tommy Fury and suggested production didn’t paint her in the best light.

When asked by the Mirror Online whether she felt she’d been on the receiving end of a bad edit, the 21-year-old said: ‘Yeah I guess so.’

She continued: ‘Obviously there’s the [compilation show] Unseen Bits and stuff and I have caught up on a few, but there’s still no bits in it that were hilarious. That didn’t really get shown.’

Despite having the word ‘love’ in its title, Love Island came under some criticism this year for focusing too heavily on romantic relationships between the Islanders at the expense of their friendships and sillier stuff.

‘I feel like hopefully for the next one they’ll show a lot more of the funny things because I think a lot of people really wanna see that stuff,’ Lucie said, ‘I think it’s really relatable and it’s entertaining, isn’t it?’

With boyfriend Joe Garratt (Picture: Bob Grey/BACKGRID)

We have to agree with you there, Lucie!

Since leaving the villa, the TV personality has rekindled things with her on/off partner Joe, with the couple having met on their first day in the villa.

Speaking to Metro.co.uk about their flourishing romance, Lucie revealed: ‘We just didn’t like anyone else. He really liked me, I really liked him. We weren’t looking for anyone else.

‘We went on the show to find someone so we just had that connection straight away. So coming home we’ve got to know each other a lot more outside the villa so we’re enjoying it and we’re back together.’

Lover Island is available to stream on the ITV Hub.
